page.title: 05EDUCATION IN ROGERSTONE
page.content: The largest school in our area is Bassaleg Comprehensive School which has pupils aged from 11-18.There are also 4 Primary schools in the area for pupils aged 5-11.Cefn Wood Primary School was built in 1976 to replace the old Rogerstone Board School;Mount Pleasant Primary School was built in 1975 on a new estate.Rhiwderin Primary School and Bassaleg Controlled Voluntary School were both built in the last century to serve the workers on the estate of Lord Tredegar,whose family endowed the original school in St.Basil's churchyard.Both these last named schools are to be merged on a new site at Pentrepoeth in the near future,and the Bassaleg school will lose its long association with the church of St.Basils.
